comment: Fun class and nice professor. But the class grading wise had only two essays and a final exam. However, the teacher was a super harsh grader and final exam was extremely difficult with little guidance and no study guide. I had to drop the class because I didn't want a pilates class to ruin my gpa despite only missing one class the entire semester.

comment: Do not take her! This was a 1 credit class and required more time to study than all of my other classes. The final exam was also way too long for the class time that we had. Attendance is mandatory. Her lectures were confusing and people do not know if they're going to pass or not as she said she was putting grades in the last day of grading.

comment: I took beginning yoga with Professor Tufts. She is very sweet and patient and is an overall great instructor. Do not be fooled by it being yoga, the workouts are hard. It was beneficial though and by the end I was stronger and more confident in my abilities. Attendance is the most important thing so don't skip!

Since this class is a workout class we were mainly graded by our attendance. So just SHOW UP She is very nice. Only complaint is that I didn't feel very prepared but she does give minimal notes at the beginning or end of class for your journal so write down everything and reflect on what she says to get a better understanding.
The workout is great but she won't teach anything that is on the final. Showed up to every class and took notes and made a C. Not even kidding, was one of the most difficult tests I've taken.

comment: This professor is not a beginning level pilates instructor, she is very tough on you unless you have prior injuries. comment: Great Pilates instructor!  Inspired me to work hard, and keen on biomechanics.

Good pilates teacher. The exercises you do in class are beneficial and help you feel more comfortable with pilates. However she talks about other topics besides pilates and doesn't provide resources, and then tests you on things that she mentioned once in class. There is one test and the questions aren't specific. It takes over a month to get grade

comment: I took this class just to be full time and it was definitely an easy A class. All you need to do is come to every class, TRY the exercises, and write journal entries. The final is kind of hard, but if you listen to the terminology and health stuff she says throughout the session you should be fine. No textbook required but personal yoga mat is.
